summary: The Clean Hands Firearm Procurement Act mandates the Attorney General to publish an annual list of federally licensed firearms dealers with a high number of firearms linked to crimes within a short timeframe (time-to-crime). Federal agencies are prohibited from contracting with dealers on this list. Waivers are allowed for national security reasons, requiring notification of relevant Congressional committees. The act defines key terms like "covered firearms dealer" and "time-to-crime".
